_exec_summary.SummaryText:
City of Huntsville Palm Street Water Plant Executive Summary

The City of Huntsville continues to implement a comprehensive program to safely manage chlorine at its Palm Street Water Plant at 596 Palm Street in Huntsville, Texas.  Generally, this is achieved through adequate training of employees, maintenance of facilities and process equipment, and provision of suitable safety equipment.  City administration continually seeks to improve the safety measures that protect its employees and citizens alike.  

One ton cylinders of chlorine are used in the disinfection of the public drinking water supply. 4,000 pounds of chlorine are stored at Palm Street Plant. There have been no chlorine incidents or accidents at this facility.

In order to reduce the likelihood of a potential release, the City of Huntsville has incorporated the following general accidental release prevention program and chlorine specific prevention steps:

A?    Maintenance staff shall conduct routine preventative maintenance of key process components.
A?    Employees shall conduct all work according to any applicable Lockout/Tag-out procedures.
A?    The City of Huntsville shall maintain a routine inspection schedule.
A?    Employees shall be trained on the operation and maintenance of all the chlorine facilities.
A?    Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for all chlorine operations and maintenance shall be adhered to.
A?    Only those persons trained in chlorine safety shall be present during any work that could produce a release.


The City of HuntsvilleA?s emergency response program uses the Huntsville Fire Department Hazardous Materials Response Team.  It focuses on keeping employees away from dangerous areas, while the Fire Department responds to and controls the chemical release.  When an employee observes a release, he/she shall leave the problem area, proceed to a staging area and take a roll call, notify one of the emergency responders, and leave the area.

We are currently rewriting the safety manual for th
e City of Huntsville and reviewing all safety procedures & policies.
